content: this is a legal summary of a case involving a coownership community of real estate the case has been ongoing since june 29 2016 and has now reached its final resolution after 3 years and 9 months the court has determined that the property consists of a house three auxiliary buildings a yard and an orchard the coowners identified as km and mm each own a ½ share of the property the court has decided to divide the property through a public sale with the purchase price distributed according to the coownership ratios the secondinstance court has dismissed the counterpartys appeal and confirmed the decision of the municipal court the court has determined that a geometric division of the property is not possible due to technical limitations and the absence of separate entrances and municipal connections the costs of the proceedings will be shared between the parties based on their ownership shares the counterpartys request for complete reimbursement of costs has been rejected the supreme court has reviewed the case and found that the firstinstance court correctly applied the law and confirmed the original decision
